ratings.comment: Had him for Math 222 and 234.  He tests students on solving problems not memorizing proofs.  If you take notes (you don't have to pay attention to his proofs), do practice problems, then you will be fine.  He is hard to understand so sit in front.

Many people give up on his lectures. He mumbles, is hard to follow and goes very very fast. I still went to lecture and learned to just write down the examples he gives you. Once you learn the method who cares about deriving it since he never asks for it. Exams are easy and just like the homework. Definitely get the answer book.

Tough lecture but pretty easy exams and the curve is generous.  As long as you do 85 or above, you'll get an A.  Had him for 221, 222, and 234 and got all good grades. 234 is the only class without a curve, which I don't know why because that was the hardest of the three.

Really hard tests, but homework problems are somewhat straight forward. You have to go to lecture to get the homework assignments.  You will need to use the book daily because you are teaching yourself everything.  Not an easy class by any means.
Extremely intense lectures, flies through materials.  Okay if you have a good TA, sometimes unable to follow though if you don't.  Exams are tough, but do-able.

Professor ****ey tends to talk to the board a lot, but that's not his problem. The material is fairly easy to grasp if you pay attention, but it seemed like his exams were just ridiculous.  They're much harder than what he does in lecture and there's really no way to fully prepare for them. Other than that, he's fine.

Lectures are pretty much useless. This guy doesn't explain anything, and it's terribly hard to read his hand writing. He seems like an alright guy, and cracks a few jokes here and there, but be ready to teach yourself or completely rely on your TA. Exams are very difficult with little room for error.
he is the most adorable professor on the planet earth! I absolutely love him!!!
Really easy tests, straigh homework problems.  Come to lecture to get the homework, memorize the book, and it's an easy A.

Nice guy, but not a very good teacher. He is not clear at all, and rarely explains to the class what he is actually showing them. He doesn't use a microphone, and talks into the board, so be sure to get a close seat. Goes VERY fast, and rarely asks for questions. Tests are similar to book problems and are fairly easy as long as you do the hw
Very nice guy. You know what you are going to get from him and what he wants. Not a bad professor
Absolutely terrible lecturer but tests are fair. Difficult but fair...
He is a nice guy, but the class is tough. If you study the tests aren't that hard. He never puts proofs on the tests, and the problems are ussually pretty basic. A good TA is REALLY NICE.

He isnt that bad.The key is to come to lecture and watch the examples and to do practice problems when hes going through proofs.He may go fast through his examples but he will quickly go into a proof after an example so you can catch up during that if you have to. Always in office willing to answer questions.  Good TA helps alot too.
He doesn't speak loud enough for the large lecture hall that he teaches in.  He also runs through the material at an extreme pace.

Horrible teacher and class unless you have a good TA.  Stutters and mumbles when talking and handwriting is inlegible so lecture is useless.Tests are hard and he assigns homework after every class.The only good thing about the class is he curves the tests which saved everyone since everyone did horrible.If you take him MAKE SURE to have a GREAT TA!
He has the worst handwriting ever. he also stutters A LOT. he also stands in front of what he writes so you are always behind in taking notes. Tests are very hard. do not take dickey.

Handwriting is much better than before. At least now he writes in caps. Teaches by the book and exams are very similar to textbook examples or homework problems. No problem if you read the book and do the homework!

He is horrible! You can not read at all what he writes, he does not explain anything, he talks to the board, I could go on and on about how bad he is. No one ever shows up to lecture because it is pointless. The curve is 1/3 of students get A's and B's, 1/3 get C's, and 1/3 get D's and F's.

Lectures from bell to bell everyday.  Writes sloppy cursive which is nearly impossible to read before getting used to it well into the semester.  Tests are next to impossible with material not covered in class.
Horrible, not reccomended to anyone

Dickey is awful.  Unless you have already had BC in high school and are just looking for review, get out.  He writes illegibal examples straight out of the book and talks into the board while doing so.  You can try to teach yourself but the tests are much harder than the homework so it's nearly impossible.

Scribbles material on the board that is directly from the text book. Will complete a whole problem and then realize the end solution is incorrect because he made a mistake at the very begining, and has to take five min doing the problem all over again... DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSES
He scribles on the board, and studders. Avoid him!
poor  cursive handwriting, goes very fast and talks to the board

Lectures consist of writing material straight out of the textbook. Occassionally, he stops to ask "Are there any questions?" I made the mistake of taking him up a few times on the offer to ask for clarification, and he always prefaced his reply with: "Well it should be OBVIOUS that...." Take this course with a different professor.

He can be very helpful if you go to his office hours, but you still will have trouble keeping up.  His hand writing is terrible and he goes so fast you can't keep up.  His tests are impossible, expect class averages to be below 50%.  If you have him, good luck, you'll need it.
The guy rambles, he is hard to keep up with, I never knew what was going on.

Dickey Dickey, besides having an unfortunate last name, you really do suck at teaching.  You talk AT the board, your handwriting is illegible tho it doesnt matter bc u stand in front of the board.You dont emphasis things that i know should be.  Your tests suck and oh yeah you prounounced 'washer' "waysher" Learn to care about us understanding jerk!

Dickey is the worst professor I've ever had.  He talks into the chalkboard and mumbles.  It's nearly impossible to pay attention in lecture.  I also had an awful TA that had no idea what he was talking about.  AVOID him at all costs.
Avoid at all costs!!  Worst exams ever

by far, the WORST professor i have had.illegible handwriting, talks to the board, doesn't clarify, monotone voice, examples very poor. dont take unless u must, but try to find a diff prof or hope ur TA is awesome-- take calc 211 instead
Worst professor ever!  Doesn't really teach, just rewrites the book horribly on the board.  This class killed my gpa.  Do not take dickey

Arguably the worse college class I've ever taken.  The other reviews are 100% correct about his atrocious handwriting.  He is also extremely difficult to understand, and all of his examples come directly out of the book.  When questions are asked in lecture, he repeats exactly what he just said and moves on.  I would avoid this one like the plague.
he is evil
The only thing that I learned in Prof. Dickey's lectures was Illegible writing+Incessant monotonous drone+Illiterate TA= Worst class ever

Worst professor ever. He needs to take some teaching classes. His lectures consist of Dickey writing illegibly on the board while mumbling to himself. The TAs could keep up with helping teach the subject matter. His examples were his explanations rewritten with new variables. Avoid this prof.

Professor Dickey obviously understands the material, but his presentation is in such a fashion that you have to figure out a lot of the stuff by yourself.  I wouldn't have minded this if it was a lower level math class, but in higher levels this is just frustrating.

Dickey is one of the worst professors I have ever had. You cannot read his handwriting at all, and when he is writing on the board he is standing infront of it talking.  You also cannot understand what he says. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS FROM HIM!!!
By far one of the worst professors I've ever had. Exams are pretty easy, but it shows he doesn't care what so ever about the class and you!
yea, if you haven't taken a calc course before this class you're screwed.  only good thing about him is that he appears to be a jolly man, however he's a terrible professor
Wow...what could i understand  not handwriting, not hismumbleing and facing the board... i understood him durring only one lecture... the last one... you are better off reading the book

He has the worst handwriting ever!  He likes to abbreviate the trig functions with s for sin and c for cos (maybe csc, you just don't know).  He is boring and does the same exact examples from the book.  The only way to do well is study reall hard homework problems or teach yourself the material.

The concepts arent as hard as his tests and teaching method are. He mumbles, stutters, doesn't explain problems as much as prove EVERYTHING. If you have a little problem with Calc or math, do not take him.  also, watch out for his Chinese TA. speaks a little english but hard to learn from.

DONT TAKE DICKEY! He cant teach.He stutters and mumbles while facing the board the entire class. If you've taken calc before his tests aren't too bad. If you dont know calc youre gonna have to learn on your own. He doesnt explain anything goes too fast and writes in illegible abbreviated cursive.

Here's an equation to remember (5 credit calc) = (don't take dickey). The tests are only five large questions that cover a months worth of material (not cool). So half of what you study isn't on the test. Forget how to do some technique on a test or two, and you get a C in the class.

this guy sucks. i speak on behalf of all of his calc 221 lectures for the fall 2004 semester. he's fidgety, he stutters really bad, he goes too fast, makes way too many mistakes, i stopped going to lectures because i ace the tests by reading n learning from the book. find another professor.
mumbles, rarely looks out to the class, almost impossible to read his writing.  Easier to just learn material out of the book.
Does not move his wrist when he writes on the board.  Imagine that before you decide to take his class.
Easily the worst teacher I have ever encountered, get out as soon as you can.
Tests are really easy, just be able to teach yourself out of the book and your set with an A

He starts to talk before the class quiets.  He mumbles and talks directly to one of his 6 sliding chalk boards.  His penminship is so messy, you cant follow anything he says.  One good thing though, he does lots of good examples in class.
Ridiculously hard to follow, mumbles, unclear handwriting, unaccessible.  If you want to learn intro calc, take another prof.

Well lets see...he prefaces everything he says with "aahh, let me just say that...", he teaches like its review material, and he's difficult to understand. Doesn't sound like a good lecture prof to me but i'll let you decide for yourself.

He teaches this course as if it were a review.  If you have already taken Calc 234, or its equivalent, and you just want to brush-up, you'll be fine.  If you need to learn the material for the first time, I suggest taking Prof Isaac.  He's great.

Awful.  Teaches nothing. Lecture is 100% useless because he goes so fast, doesn't explain, doesn't write ENGLISH and doesn't even calculate things correctly. He goes so fast he messes himself up.  AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE

If you need any kind of help with calc, don't take Dickey. You can't understand what he's saying, you can't read his writing, and if you could, it doesn't matter because he stands in front of the board. The only good thing is that his tests are fair.

Doesn't try to explain the material.  Zips through everything.  I couldn't read his handwriting.  His tests were long and hard to finish in the alloted time.  HW not hard, but he only gave a day to do it which was difficult to balance with other classes a
No Comments

Thank god this guys was only a sub for a week.  I couldn't keep up while trying to take notes, he went so fast.  His lecturing style implies that he expects the student to already be mathamaticians, and are not learning as much as reviewing.
No Comments
Terrible writing on the board.  Stumbles over his own words.  Homework not difficult, but tests are pretty tough.
Illegibile  handwriting , lectures the board instead of the students, not receptive to student input
Lousy writing, expects you to already be an expert on the material, mumbles
No Comments
dickey kicks ass
No Comments

You better be reeeeally good at it, this professor goes like a freight-train, superfast..we covered 10 chapters of honors calculus, the test means were quite low too and high dropout rates in first week or so.
No Comments
No Comments
Mumbler
chicken scratch writing,  Not helpful in office hours,  does not deal well with
